title: Drawing, "Hemlock on the Hillside at the Back of Mr. Willies, North Conway, New Hampshire", August 6, 1855
markings: Verso: Stamped in black ink: Museum for Arts of Decoration Cooper Union
inscribed: Inscribed and dated in graphite, lower right: trunk purplish grey [sic]/ with some light grey & green moss -1/& lighter brownish touches on/lights of bark; near view of trunk/ not seen in sketch [?] below hill; ground. Hemlock on hillside/ back of Mr. Willies/ North Conway Aug 6 55; near view of leafage.
description:
Vertical view of a large, full hemlock at center, surrounded by partial sketches.  Near view of trunk at right. Details of foliage, below, with notes.
[see remarks for greater detail]

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Hemlock on the Hillside at the Back of Mr. Willies, North Conway, New Hampshire", August 6, 1855.
August 6, 1855. Graphite on cream-colored wove paper.. Bequest of Erskine Hewitt. 1942-50-39.
